page.title: 16WEST FELTON TRANSPORT
page.content: THE MAIN A5 HOLYHEAD TO LONDON ROAD DIVIDES THE VILLAGE,BUT WORK HAS BEGUN THIS YEAR ON A NEW BY-PASS,DUE TO BE COMPLETED IN 1987.TRAFFIC IS HEAVY WITH MANY LARGE ARTICULATED LORRIES THUNDERING THROUGH AT CONSIDERABLE SPEED.HOLIDAY TRAFFIC IS PARTICULARLY HEAVY IN THE HEIGHT OF SUMMER ,AND WEEKEND TRAFFIC ON A FRIDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT BUILDS UP QUITE EARLY IN THE YEAR. THE BY-PASS WILL RUN FROM WEIRBROOK TO QUEENS HEAD AND WILL BE CROSSED BY A FOOTBRIDGE IN FOX LANE AND A ROAD BRIDGE IN THE AVENUE. AS MOST OF THE HEAVY,FAST TRAFFIC WILL BE TAKEN OUT OF THE VILLAGE IT WILL BECOME MUCH QUIETER,AND THERE WILL BE MORE AND WIDER PEDESTRIAN MOVEMENT OVER THE VILLAGE AS A WHOLE. A BRIDGE IS BEING BUILT OVER THE CANAL AT QUEENS HEAD FOR RE-OPENING.
